name: Elementary French II
description: This course is designed for students who have taken first-semester French at Carnegie Mellon or its equivalent. Students will develop contextually appropriate interpersonal communication skills in both written and spoken French, develop reading and listening skills through various media (audio CD, video, CD ROM, ML server, Internet), understand and begin to control fundamental grammar, acquire vocabulary, and gain a basic understanding of French/francophone cultures. The elementary level is also designed to help students learn to reflect upon and draw upon strategies used by good language learners in their second language study. Regular homework and participation in class are mandatory (four in-class hours per week). If a student has studied French outside of Carnegie Mellon, then s/he must take the placement exam. Instructions for taking the placement exam are in Baker Hall 160. Prerequisites or placement exam.
